snippet: At a time of slashed judicial budgets across the country, the Bronx, New York’s poorest borough, is a stark picture of what happens when an overwhelmed justice system cannot keep up.
abstract: Plague of delays in Bronx criminal courts is undermining promise of speedy trial, one of justice system's central ideals; failures in Bronx offer stark picture of what happens when overwhelmed system cannot keep up, particularly at time of slashed judicial budgets nationwide (Series: Justice Denied).

byline.contributor: Alice Brennan, Jo Craven McGinty and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: At a time of slashed judicial budgets across the country, the Bronx, New York’s poorest borough, is a stark picture of what happens when an overwhelmed justice system cannot keep up.

headline.seo: Justice Denied | Bronx Court System Mired in Delays
headline.print_headline: Waiting Years for Day in Court
